message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you the chance to purchase this product. Given its immense value and potential, I'm initially proposing a price of $1,100,000. I believe this represents a fair starting point for our discussion.
I appreciate your initial offer, but I'm looking to negotiate a better price. I'm willing to pay $900,000 for the product. I believe this is a fair price considering the market value and my budget.
Bob, I appreciate you countering. I'm willing to come down a bit, but $900,000 is too low. How about we meet in the middle at $1,000,000? This reflects the true value of the product.

I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $1,000,000 is still too high for me. I'm willing to pay $950,000 for the product. I think this is a fair compromise considering the value you're placing on it.

Bob, I understand your position, but I need to be closer to my minimum for this to make sense. I'm willing to go down to $975,000.  This is my final offer, as I have another buyer interested at a higher price point.
I understand your position, but $975,000 is still too high for me. I'm willing to pay $925,000 for the product. I think this is a fair compromise considering the value you're placing on it.
